title: X Factor – who is Kevin McHale dating and what's he been in since Glee?
text:
Kevin is hardly recognisable from his role as Artie in Glee (Picture: David Fishger/Patrick Ecclesine/Fox-Tv/Kobal/REX)

Kevin McHale stunned judges with his emotional cover of Camila Cabello’s hit Never Be The Same on last night’s The X Factor: Celebrity.

But who could expect less? He was on Glee after all…

So who exactly did Kevin play on Glee, what has he been doing since and who is he dating? Take a seat.

Who is Kevin McHale?

Born on 14 June 1988, 31-year-old Kevin is a singer and actor.

He was born in Texas but now calls the Hollywood Hills his home.

He’s best known for starring in Glee where he played the role of disabled student Artie Abrams.

Kevin as Artie Abrams on Glee(Patrick Ecclesine/Fox-Tv/Kobal/REX)

Before that he was in boy band NTL (Not Like Them), where he performed with three others.

NTL opened for Pussycat Dolls on their 2007 tour so Kevin and judge Nicole are already acquainted.

What has Kevin McHale been doing since Glee?

Since Glee finished in 2015, Kevin has taken up several presenting gigs including comedy panel show Virtually Famous, which he hosted between 2014 and 2016.

Kevin giving off some serious steez (Picture: The X Factor/ITV)

In 2017 he starred in docu-series When We Rise, together with his partner Austin.

He is currently one of four radio hosts for the show Sick of My Own Voice on digital radio station Dash Radio.

He’s also released songs such as Help Me Now and James Dean.

Who is Kevin McHale’s partner?

Kevin is dating actor Austin McKenzie.

The former Glee star sent fans into a frenzy after posting a cryptic picture of him holding hands with another man back in 2018, together with the American Sign Language (ASL) emoji for ‘I love you.’

One week later, on April 14, he posted a follow-up image with a picture of the man in question – his current partner, Austin.

26-year-old Austin originally studied ASL at University after his interest was ignited through his work at a summer camp for adults with mental and physical disabilities including those who are deaf or hard of hearing.

After graduating, he moved into acting, via his role as an interpreter on the Broadway show, Spring Awakening.

He has since been in the likes of TV mini-series When We Rise, Unhinged and Speech & Debate.

The X Factor: Celebrity is available on ITV Player.
